top_categories.workout_context: Serenissima Gravel's Venice area, Flat to rolling forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Serenissima Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
Serenissima Gravel's italian flat to rolling gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
When someone attacks on italian flat to rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
65 miles on italian flat to rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Serenissima Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Serenissima Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At Serenissima Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
2-minute all-out efforts on italian flat to rolling gravel. Closing gaps, responding to attacks, sprinting for position. Train the burn.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Long rides with hard efforts mixed in. Simulates what Serenissima Gravel's italian flat to rolling gravel actually does to you.
Smooth pedaling at 65 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Serenissima Gravel’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Serenissima Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on italian flat to rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: venice area, flat to rolling, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 65 miles of italian flat to rolling gravel in Venice, Italy.
